fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Given a lax functor (F,F^{2},F^{0}), its Grothendieck construction \mathsf {Elts}( F ) is the category defined as follows.

html:tr.html:td: An object is a pair (A,X) where A is an object in \mathcal { C } and X is an object in FA.
A morphism (A,X) \to (B,Y) consists of a morphism f \colon A \to B in \mathcal { C } and a morphism p \colon X \to F(f)Y in FA.
The identity on each object (A,X) consists of the identity morphism \mathsf {id} _{ A } \colon A \to A and the morphism (F^{0}_{A})_{X} \colon X \to F( \mathsf {id} _{ A } )X.

Given a pair of composable morphisms (f,p) \colon (A,X) \to (B,Y) and (g,q) \colon (B,Y) \to (C,Z), the composite (g,q)(f,p) \colon (A,X) \to (C,Z) consists of the composite gf \colon A \to C and the composite X \xrightarrow { p } F(f)Y \xrightarrow { F(f)q } F(f)F(g)Z \xrightarrow { (F^{2}_{f,g})_{Z} } F(gf)Z
